conclusion: The toy car A is traveling left-ward toward the nearest small blue cube that lies almost directly in its path.
The scene contains multiple colored blocks: small blue cubes, larger green cubes, orange cubes, red cubes, yellow cubes, and a purple cube scattered on a green surface.
The toy car A is positioned on the right side of the image, facing leftward toward the nearest small blue cube.
A will first collide with the nearest small blue cube in its path.
Upon collision, the blue cube will be pushed forward a short distance, and A will deflect slightly to the left.
After deflection, A will continue on a shallower, left-slanting trajectory.
The new trajectory of A aligns with the larger green cube near the lower center of the scene.
A will collide with the larger green cube next.
The impact with the heavier green cube absorbs most of Aâ€™s remaining kinetic energy.
After the second collision, the car comes to rest against the green cube, just to its right-hand side.

Summary: First collision is with the closest small blue cube. Second (final) collision is with the larger green cube near the lower center. Stopping point is immediately next to the right side of the green cube.
